intro: Mouriri cyphocarpa, commonly known as the red murici, is a small evergreen tree native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round, red fruits that are edible and often consumed by both humans and wildlife. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and disturbed areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
